title: Checkpoint sync fails to start - "requesting" log lines not appearing

# ðŸ’Ž Issue

### Background

Prysm v4.0.6

geth 1.12.0

That's how I start Prysm:

```
beacon-chain --execution-endpoint=http://localhost:8551 --jwt-secret=/path/to/jwt.hex --datadir=/path/to/consensus --accept-terms-of-use --checkpoint-sync-url=https://beaconstate-mainnet.chainsafe.io --genesis-beacon-api-url=https://beaconstate-mainnet.chainsafe.io
```

And here's the guide I'm trying to follow:

https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/prysm-usage/checkpoint-sync

### Description

> To confirm that checkpoint sync has succeeded, look for the following output:
> ```level=info msg="requesting <your configured checkpoint sync endpoint>"```

I don't see these lines - `$my_command_line | grep requesting` prints nothing no matter how long I wait.

I got this message, among others

```
msg="Synced to finalized epoch - now syncing blocks up to current head" currentSlot=7202416 prefix=initial-sync syncedSlot=7202409
```

and since then it only prints "synced new block" stuff.

Data generated by Prysm currently occupies about 7 GB - I believe I'm very far from being fully synced.

Oh by the way, I thought maybe the guide is obsolete and these log lines are no longer printed in newer prysm versions even if the connection is actually happening. So I tried `netstat -tupa` just in case. Still nothing related to my configured checkpoint provider.

Am I missing something?
